page.title: 19Bexford Industries, Brantham
page.content: On Tuesday 25th June 1985 we went to visit Bexford Industries at Cattawade. Five hundred people are employed there working in four shifts, as the firm is working 24 hours a day. When we arrived we were asked if we had any lighters or matches on us because of the explosive nature of the materials used to make the plastics. We were also given little red cards to wear to say that we were visitors. We first visited the main store, containing millions of pounds worth of equipment ready for shipment all over the world. We were also shown the cold store where they kept the microfilm, the temperature was kept at 50 Farenheit. We saw the plastic being cut and packed. We then walked over to the firm's own fire station, our guide was the chief of the fire station. By Alan Hynes & Wayne Hill, aged 14yrs
